works.company_name: University of Texas at Arlington, United States
achievements: Involved in leading discussions and provided one-on-one assistance for graduate students enrolled in Machine Learning course, resulting in improved understanding of intricate concepts and algorithms.
Took on leadership roles in mentoring and guiding students through complex course material.
Evaluated and graded assignments, providing constructive feedback to students to aid in their learning.

Collaborated in a cross functional team to design and implement a data-driven proof of concept (POC) prototype for an early warning system, contributing to a 10% reduction in off-spec production and demonstrated its success through precise alerts for process health, contributing to continuous optimization.

Developed a proactive Machine Learning optimization algorithm by incorporating Artificial Intelligence capabilities. Gained hands-on experience in addressing potential issues proactively, positively impacting production KPIs through actionable insights.
Integrated and tested the prototype built using PyQt5, providing valuable insights into variability issues in process manufacturing and offering guidance to users for appropriate process adjustments.
Earned recognition for the prototype's capability in elevating business value of the product.
Involved in building and fine-tuning machine learning models. This included selecting appropriate algorithms, optimizing hyperparameters, and enhancing model performance.
Gained proficiency in data collection, preprocessing and cleaning. This involved working with large datasets, ensuring data quality, and transforming data into a suitable format for analysis.
Applied various data analysis techniques to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets. This included statistical analysis, feature engineering, and data visualization.
